results.title: Earth's structures
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Geographical features like mountains are evidence of the tremendous forces that occur within the Earth such as the movement of the Tectonic Plates. The faults and folds of rocks, caused by this movement often results in vertical motion which causes rises and layering in the landscape. This episode looks at the crustal stresses, the principle of Original Horizontality, the formation of resources such as petrol and the measurement of de-formation of land structures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television

results.title: Mountain building
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Mountains are evidence which enable geologists to study not only the movements of the Earth’s plates, but the composition of the interior structure of the Mantle. The Rock cycle whereby material from and below the crust is metamorphosed is also explained which enables geologists to determined how land masses are created and fused together into larger parts, eventually becoming mountain ranges. Fossil evidence and magnetic forces enable the geologist to determine the age and structure of terrain.

results.title: The Blue yonder
results.creator_credit: Mark Rosman, Alan Shapiro, Annette Handley, Susan B Landau and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: 11-year-old Jonathan Knicks (Huckleberry Fox) is posed with an intriguing question about time travel by aviator/inventor Max Knickerbocker (Peter Coyote). He’s asking the wrong person, as Max is already an experienced time travellers thanks to the efforts of the time machine built by his neighbour, Henry Coogan (Art Carney). Unbenowst to Jonathan, Max is also his grandson and the time machine has allowed them to meet. Max learns that his discovery of the past and the fate of his grandfather forces him to decide whether to alter the course of the future. Also starring Dennis Lipscomb, Joe Flood and Mittie Smith.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Rosman, Alan Shapiro, Annette Handley, Susan B Landau and Walt Disney Productions

results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Earth revealed”.
This episode introduces the vast field of geology and the work undertaken by scientists in that and other related fields. Excellent visuals stimulate the viewer’s appreciation of the Earth and a broad overview is provided on Plate Tectonics, earthquakes, seismology and the origins of our planet.

results.title: The Blizzard of Aahhh's
results.brief_description: Take three of the world’s best stunt skiers - cliff-jumper Scot Schmidt, extreme skier - Bad boy Glen Plake, and precision skier Mike Hattrup … transport them to the finest steep terrain in the world - from Switzerland to France’s Chamonix Valley to California’s awe inspiring Squaw Valley … engage some slick cameramen … set the results to an original soundtrack ranging from hot rap to Euro-funk, including Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Propaganda and ACT … and what do you have? “The Blizzard of AAHHH’s” - a vividly photographed, tightly edited rock video movie. Ever bolder jumps, twists, straight shots through chutes, games of chicken with crevasses and other activities designed to make insurance company rate-setters squeal with delight! Rated: G

results.title: The Blue Planet (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, Dept of Marine Services and University of Sydney Television Service
results.brief_description: Looks at the oceans of the World and the development of, and basics of oceanography. Considers the effect and benefit of scientific study of the oceans for sailors, yachtsmen, surfers, environmentalists, scientists, engineers and architects.

results.title: The Blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton, Malcolm St Clair, Joseph Schenck, Raymond Rohauer and Buster Keaton Films
results.brief_description: Buster Keaton as a hapless blacksmith muddles his way through various comic situations in inimitable Keaton style. New shoes for a lady’s horse, a revolutionary saddle for another lady rider, repairs to a young fop’s expensive car and an encounter with a bratty child, lead to inevitable mayhem but with Buster emerging triumphant in the end. Cast also includes Joe Roberts and Virginia Fox.

results.title: Best of friends
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, ABC-TV (Australia) and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Six stories featuring the courageous pink elephant and his friends who amongst the clutter in Michael’s bedroom. The stories are: “Beginnings”, “Under the bed”, “Best of friends”, “The Thing outside”, “Helpless”, and “Moving house”.
